definition: old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: Bidding for the Olympic Games is, in a way, an image-creating undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 申辦奧運會從某種角度上說是一個塑造形象的工程。

sentences.english: B: People are still bathing in the afterglow of its selection as the 2008 Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 人們仍然沉浸在成功申辦2008年奧運會的喜悅中。

sentences.english: As for bidding for the World Cup, we cut off ourselves before others cut us off.
sentences.chinese: 關於申辦世界盃，我們是沒被人宮先自宮。

sentences.english: Palermo and rumblings of a proposal from southern city Bari followed.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒莫和南部城市巴里也不甘落後地表示了申辦意願。

sentences.english: Humiliated England loses out again, refuses to congratulate Russia.
sentences.chinese: 英國申辦世界盃失利給贏家俄羅斯冷臉。

sentences.english: Hello, I'd like to get a new cell phone number.
sentences.chinese: 妳好，我想要申辦一個新手機門號。

sentences.english: A committee that a sponsor may organize to coordinate the conduct of a multicentre trial.
sentences.chinese: 申辦者組織的協調實施多中心試驗的委員會。

sentences.english: Liu said the bidding should be as fair as the track and field events themselves.
sentences.chinese: 劉淇說，申辦活動應該像田賽和徑賽本身一樣公平。

sentences.english: The South Korean resort of Pyeongchang has been selected to host the 2018 Winter Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 已被選爲韓國的平昌度假申辦2018年冬季奧運會。

sentences.english: The other snipes in the bid group are cancelled as soon as one of them is won.
sentences.chinese: 其他斯奈普斯在申辦小組取消儘快其中一人是韓元。

sentences.english: If you just want to bid and think Drupa is easy, you are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是想申辦，並認爲德魯巴很容易，你就錯了。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the Chinese abandoned the 2026 World Cup bid.
sentences.chinese: 還好，中國人放棄了2026年世界盃申辦權。

sentences.english: How can I apply for a premium MasterCard card?
sentences.chinese: 我怎樣才能申辦萬事達卡白金卡呢？

sentences.english: We're giving coupons to customers who sign up with us this week.
sentences.chinese: 本週申辦會員的顧客我們將贈送折價券。

sentences.english: The bidding should be as fair as the track and field events themselves.
sentences.chinese: 申辦活動應當像田賽和徑賽本身一樣公平。

sentences.english: Beckenbauer flew to South Africa before the vote to urge support for Germany's bid.
sentences.chinese: 貝肯鮑爾飛赴南非在投票前呼籲支持德國申辦。

definition: to set/to designate/to stipulate/to provide/to draw up/to formulate (rules etc)/stipulation
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
